name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we will compare to benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of a methyl group, two additional phenyl rings, and three additional methyl groups. The methyl group introduces a small increase in molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +5°C. The additional phenyl groups contribute to an increase in molecular weight and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20°C per group, totaling +40°C. The three additional methyl groups can raise the melting point due to increased molecular weight and rigidity, estimated at around +5°C each.
